verses.text: Then said the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* unto me, Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, \add yet\add* my mind \add could\add* not \add be\add* toward this people : cast \add them\add* out of my sight , and let them go forth.

And it shall come to pass, if they say unto thee, Whither shall we go forth ? then thou shalt tell them, Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; Such as \add are\add* for death , to death ; and such as \add are\add* for the sword , to the sword ; and such as \add are\add* for the famine , to the famine ; and such as \add are\add* for the captivity , to the captivity.

And I will appoint over them four kinds , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: the sword to slay , and the dogs to tear , and the fowls of the heaven , and the beasts of the earth , to devour and destroy.\f + \fr 15.3 \ft kinds: Heb. families\f*

And I will cause them to be removed into all kingdoms of the earth , because of Manasseh the son of Hezekiah king of Judah , for \add that\add* which he did in Jerusalem.\f + \fr 15.4 \ft cause…: Heb. give them for a removing\f*
For who shall have pity upon thee, O Jerusalem ? or who shall bemoan thee? or who shall go aside to ask how thou doest ?\f + \fr 15.5 \ft how…: Heb. of thy peace?\f*
Thou hast forsaken me, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, thou art gone backward : therefore will I stretch out my hand against thee, and destroy thee; I am weary with repenting.

And I will fan them with a fan in the gates of the land ; I will bereave \add them\add* of children, I will destroy my people , \add since\add* they return not from their ways.\f + \fr 15.7 \ft children: or, whatsoever is dear\f*

Their widows are increased to me above the sand of the seas : I have brought upon them against the mother of the young men a spoiler at noonday : I have caused \add him\add* to fall upon it suddenly , and terrors upon the city.\f + \fr 15.8 \ft the mother…: or, the mother city a young man spoiling, etc, or, the mother and the young men\f*

She that hath borne seven languisheth : she hath given up the ghost ; her sun is gone down while \add it was\add* yet day : she hath been ashamed and confounded : and the residue of them will I deliver to the sword before their enemies , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p

¶ Woe is me, my mother , that thou hast borne me a man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth ! I have neither lent on usury , nor men have lent to me on usury ; \add yet\add* every one of them doth curse me.

The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said , Verily it shall be well with thy remnant ; verily I will cause the enemy to entreat thee \add well\add* in the time of evil and in the time of affliction.\f + \fr 15.11 \ft cause…: or, intreat the enemy for thee\f*
Shall iron break the northern iron and the steel ?
Thy substance and thy treasures will I give to the spoil without price , and \add that\add* for all thy sins , even in all thy borders.
And I will make \add thee\add* to pass with thine enemies into a land \add which\add* thou knowest not: for a fire is kindled in mine anger , \add which\add* shall burn upon you. \p

¶ O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, thou knowest : remember me, and visit me, and revenge me of my persecutors ; take me not away in thy longsuffering : know that for thy sake I have suffered rebuke.

Thy words were found , and I did eat them; and thy word was unto me the joy and rejoicing of mine heart : for I am called by thy name , O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of hosts.\f + \fr 15.16 \ft I am…: Heb. thy name is called upon me\f*
I sat not in the assembly of the mockers , nor rejoiced ; I sat alone because of thy hand : for thou hast filled me with indignation.

Why is my pain perpetual , and my wound incurable , \add which\add* refuseth to be healed ? wilt thou be altogether unto me as a liar , \add and as\add* waters \add that\add* fail ?\f + \fr 15.18 \ft fail: Heb. be not sure?\f* \p

¶ Therefore thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, If thou return , then will I bring thee again , \add and\add* thou shalt stand before me: and if thou take forth the precious from the vile , thou shalt be as my mouth : let them return unto thee; but return not thou unto them.

And I will make thee unto this people a fenced brasen wall : and they shall fight against thee, but they shall not prevail against thee: for I \add am\add* with thee to save thee and to deliver thee, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
And I will deliver thee out of the hand of the wicked , and I will redeem thee out of the hand of the terrible.
